{{Infobox OS | name = MilaX | logo = | screenshot = [[Image:Milax04.png|200px]] | caption = MilaX 0.4 desktop | developer = [[Alexander Eremin]] | family = [[Unix-like]] | source_model = [[Open source]] | frequently_updated = yes | working_state = Current | kernel_type = [[Monolithic kernel|Monolithic]] | ui = [[JWM]] (previously [[FVWM]]) | license = [[CDDL]] | website = [http://www.milax.org/ www.milax.org] }} '''MilaX''' is an [[OpenSolaris]] [[Live CD]] distro designed to fit on a business-card sized [[miniCD]]. [[x86]] and [[SPARC]] versions are downloadable in bootable [[ISO 9660]] and [[USB mass storage|USB disk]] images. The Live CD can also be used to install the operating system to a hard disk through with [[ZFS]]-boot support. MilaX can be successfully loaded in [[Vmware]], [[Qemu]] and [[VirtualBox]]. Still small, it features light applications such as [[JWM]], [[Beaver]], [[Urxvt]], [[Vim (text editor)|Vim]], [[Sylpheed]], [[Midnight Commander]], [[Midori (web browser)|Midori]], [[XMMS]], [[ePDFView]], [[VNC]] viewer, [[Rdesktop]], [[Conky (software)|Conky]]. By installing the [[SVR4]] and [[Image Packaging System|IPS]] add-ons, you can basically convert MilaX into [[OpenSolaris]]. MilaX booted into [[JWM]] [[Desktop environment|Desktop]] in about ~14 seconds on [[SSD]] drive.
